meanings.sent1: Her reflexiveness in solving problems impressed her teacher.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the reflexiveness of his actions in difficult situations.
meanings.sent3: His reflexiveness in choosing the right path always leads to success.
meanings.sent4: The reflexiveness of the mirror made her ponder her own actions.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of reflexiveness in his painting.

meanings.definition: The act of reflecting back on oneself.
meanings.sent1: Self-reflexiveness is important for personal growth.
meanings.sent2: She often engages in reflexiveness to understand her emotions better.
meanings.sent3: His reflexiveness after a mistake helps him learn and improve.
meanings.sent4: The movie's theme of reflexiveness resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: Through reflexiveness, she discovered her true passions.

meanings.definition: The property of a relation that holds between an element and itself.
meanings.sent1: Mathematicians study the reflexiveness of numbers in equations.
meanings.sent2: The reflexiveness of the concept is crucial in logic.
meanings.sent3: The reflexiveness of the equation amused the students in class.
meanings.sent4: The reflexiveness of the loop created an infinite pattern.
meanings.sent5: The reflexiveness of the algorithm simplifies the problem-solving process.
